meanings.sent1: She cradled the kitten in her arms.
meanings.sent2: The mother cradled her baby to sleep.
meanings.sent3: He cradled the fragile vase as if it were made of glass.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches cradled the swing as it gently swayed.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter cradled the injured puppy to safety.

meanings.definition: Support or protect in a way that resembles a cradle
meanings.sent1: The hammock cradled him as he relaxed in the shade.
meanings.sent2: The boat cradled the fisherman as it rocked on the water.
meanings.sent3: The giant hands of the statue seemed to cradle the tiny bird.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range cradled the valley in its protective embrace.
meanings.sent5: The soft pillow cradled her head as she drifted off to sleep.
